title: We are fantastic, are we?
description: Book chapter in *De la estabilidad al equilibrio inestable*, published by the Department of Political Science, Universidad de la República (2022).
contents:
Abstract
In this chapter we analyzed the Uruguayan political system from a comparative perspective. We showed that the system is less volatile and less fragmented than almost any other in the region. Conversely, it is the most ideologically polarized. Looking for temporal trends, we find a growing pattern in all these dimensions.

title: COVID-19 y elecciones subnacionales en Uruguay
description: Chapter of the book "La democracia a prueba. Los años que votamos en pandemia en las Américas", published by Universidad Nacional de Rosario.
contents:
In this chapter we use a rational choice approach to analyze the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on the 2020 Uruguayan sub-national elections turnout.
